summary: An FBI 302 report documenting an interview with a victim of Jeffrey Epstein, conducted on March 20, 2019, in West Palm Beach, Florida. The victim describes past abuse, harassment by Epstein's private investigators and the media, and expresses a willingness for further contact.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation; the victim describes being contacted by news outlets about him and recounts details of what occurred at his house.

connections.description: The victim states 'Something bad happened to me' in relation to Epstein and describes remembering details of Epstein's house and 'what we did.'

events.title: FBI Interview with Victim
events.description: FBI agents interviewed a victim of Jeffrey Epstein at their residence in West Palm Beach, Florida. The victim discussed the abuse, harassment by Epstein's investigators and the media, and expressed willingness for further contact.

events.title: Past Harassment by Investigators and Media
events.description: The victim stated they and other girls were 'followed, watched, threatened, and harassed' by Epstein's private investigators and the media when the case was initially investigated years prior.

keyFacts: A victim of Jeffrey Epstein was interviewed by the FBI in March 2019 and stated, 'Something bad happened to me, and I dealt with it the best way I could.'
The victim reported being harassed by Epstein's private investigators and the media during the initial investigation years earlier.
The victim indicated that any newly identified victims would need protection.
The victim remembers 'large details' like the appearance of Epstein's house and what occurred there, but not smaller details like the origin of phone calls setting up massages.
The victim was willing to be contacted for further interviews.
